panels.visual: At the caravanserai at the edge of Srinagar, Bansi approaches a grizzled caravan master. Behind him, a merchant train prepares to depart westward - camels being loaded, merchants checking goods, guards checking weapons. A journey of months to Persia and beyond. Bansi stands straight, meeting his eyes without flinching.
panels.dialogue:
Bansi.Servant: "I can work. I'm strong, I learn quick, and I don't cause trouble."
CaravanMaster: "You running from something, boy?"
Bansi.Servant: "Isn't everyone?"

panels.visual: Months later, under a vast canopy of stars more numerous than she had ever seen. Bansi tends camels by a cook-fire, part of the caravan now. She has learned to read the desert, to find water where others see only sand, to navigate by stars she once knew only from stolen scrolls. A song rises from the travelers around another fire. She is one of them now - one of those who live on the great trade roads.
panels.narration: She learned the songs of the caravan folk, the stories they told around fires beneath skies so vast they made her feel both infinitely small and strangely free.
